title: Spring forces - k for half a spring

content.question: A <math alttext="10 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> block is hung vertically from an ideal spring, stretching the spring by <math alttext="0.25 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.25</mn><mtext> m</mtext></math>. The block is removed, and the spring is cut into two segments of equal length. What is the spring constant of one of these segments?

choices.label: <math alttext="80 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>80</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="200 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>200</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="400 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>400</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="800 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>800</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="800 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>800</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
